title: Do not walk arrogantly on the earth
arabic: وَلَا تَمْشِ فِي الْأَرْضِ مَرَحًا ۖ إِنَّكَ لَنْ تَخْرِقَ الْأَرْضَ وَلَنْ تَبْلُغَ الْجِبَالَ طُولًا
translation: And do not walk arrogantly on the earth; undoubtedly, you will indeed never tear the earth apart and will never reach the mountains in height.

title: Warning for those who strut with pride
translation: A man dressed in two shawls, full of pride, was made to sink into the ground; he will continue to sink until the Day of Judgement.

title: Hold hands with companions
translation: Sometimes while walking, the Prophet ﷺ would hold the hand of his companion with his blessed hand.

title: Walk with humility
translation: When the Prophet ﷺ walked, he would stoop slightly, as if descending from a height.

title: Avoid wearing gold chains with pride
translation: Do not wear gold or metal chains to show off. It is impermissible for men.

title: Walk at a medium pace
translation: Walk neither too fast nor too slow. Avoid unnecessary hand-holding or touching out of lust.

title: Lower your gaze while walking
translation: Walk with dignity and lowered gaze. Unnecessary looking around is not Sunnah.

title: Avoid looking into homes
translation: It is inappropriate to look into balconies or windows of others' homes.

title: Avoid noisy footwear
translation: Ensure that your footwear does not make noise when walking.

title: Do not pass between two women
translation: It is prohibited to pass between two women standing or walking together.

title: Maintain cleanliness and modesty
translation: Avoid spitting, nose-blowing, scratching, or cleaning body parts publicly while walking.

title: Do not kick objects while walking
translation: Kicking items like bottles, boxes, or papers while walking is a bad habit and disrespectful.

title: Use pedestrian bridges
translation: Cross roads at designated spots and follow traffic rules. Do not risk your life carelessly.

title: Be cautious on roads and railways
translation: Do not run across roads. Obey safety rules, especially near railway tracks.

title: Walk 45 minutes daily with zikr
translation: Walk with intention of worship and zikr. Vary pace every 15 minutes for better health.

title: Drink in two or three breaths
translation: Do not drink water in one breath like a camel. Recite Bismillah before and Alhamdulillah after drinking.

title: Do not breathe into the container
translation: Avoid breathing or blowing into drinking vessels.

title: Recite Bismillah before drinking
translation: Say Bismillah before drinking water.

title: Sip in small mouthfuls
translation: Drink water in small sips to prevent harm to the liver.

title: Drink in three breaths
translation: Follow the Sunnah by drinking water in three separate breaths.

title: Drink with the right hand and be seated
translation: Use your right hand and sit while drinking water.

title: Wudu water is a cure
translation: Leftover water after Wudu cures 70 diseases. It is like Zamzam water.

title: Check for harmful things before drinking
translation: Ensure nothing harmful is in the water before drinking.

title: Recite Alhamdulillah after drinking
translation: Say Alhamdulillah after you finish drinking.

title: Duas after each breath
translation: You may recite different phrases after each breath while drinking.

title: Do not waste leftover water
translation: Leftover clean drinking water of a Muslim should not be wasted.

title: Drink the remaining drops
translation: Drink even the last drops collected in the glass after water has settled.
